subsection_content:
Insomnia can be prevented or limited simply through good habits such as:
Maintain consistent bedtimes and wake-up times every day, including weekends.; Gentle exercise to promote better sleep.; Check your medications to see if they are contributing to insomnia. If you are unsure about the medications you are taking, talk to your medical doctor.; Don't nap too much. Normally, the ideal time for a nap is 20-40 minutes and no more than 60 minutes.; Avoid or limit caffeine and alcohol, do not use nicotine.; Do not eat or drink too much at night, especially before bed.; Do not install too many electronic devices in the bedroom to avoid using devices such as TV, phone, computer before sleeping.; Do some light relaxation before bed, such as taking a warm bath, reading a book, or listening to soft music.
subsection_data:
mat ngu.json. Prevent insomnia
Insomnia can be prevented or limited simply through good habits such as:
Maintain consistent bedtimes and wake-up times every day, including weekends.; Gentle exercise to promote better sleep.; Check your medications to see if they are contributing to insomnia. If you are unsure about the medications you are taking, talk to your medical doctor.; Don't nap too much. Normally, the ideal time for a nap is 20-40 minutes and no more than 60 minutes.; Avoid or limit caffeine and alcohol, do not use nicotine.; Do not eat or drink too much at night, especially before bed.; Do not install too many electronic devices in the bedroom to avoid using devices such as TV, phone, computer before sleeping.; Do some light relaxation before bed, such as taking a warm bath, reading a book, or listening to soft music.
